Key Match Events: Jose Iglesias hit a grounder up the middle to Perdomo's left, and despite a diving attempt, the ball glanced off his glove for a base hit as pinch-runner Tyrone Taylor scored what proved to be the game-winning run.
Post-Match Reflections: Perdomo said, 'I didn't trust my instincts,' and 'I need to move on.'

Manager Torey Lovullo said, 'Every game is important, and we have that mindset down the stretch here. We want to be playing good baseball. Every game is meaningful. We're taking nothing for granted. This group is hungry, and they want to go out and play a complete baseball game. So we respect every opponent, we know the L.A. Dodgers that are coming in here, and we want to do our job the best way we can.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets beat the D-backs, 3-2, on Thursday afternoon at Chase Field.
The D-backs have dropped just their second series in their last 13 as they remain in the lead for the National League's top Wild Card spot.
